intro: Lesquerella thamnophila, commonly known as the sandburs, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States. It belongs to the genus Lesquerella within the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard plants. The plant produces small, yellow flowers and is characterized by its spiny, seed-containing burrs that aid in seed dispersal. Lesquerella thamnophila is adapted to thrive in sandy soils and is often found in disturbed or dry habitats. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystem.
